00042 template <typename T>
00043         class block_ptr_common
00044         {
00045                 template <typename> friend class block_ptr_common;
00046 
00047         // Borland 5.5.1 specific workaround
00048         typedef block_ptr_common<T> this_type;
00049 
00050         protected:
00051                 typedef T value_type;
00052                 typedef block<value_type> element_type;
00053 
00054                 value_type * po_;
00055 
00056         public:
00057                 block_ptr_common() : po_(0)
00058                 {
00059                 }
00060 
00061         ~block_ptr_common()
00062                 {
00063                         if (po_)
00064                         {
00065                                 header()->release();
00066                         }
00067                 }
00068 
00069                 template <typename V>
00070                         block_ptr_common(detail::bp::block<V> * p) : po_(p->element())
00071                         {
00072                         }
00073 
00074                 template <typename V>
00075                         block_ptr_common(block_ptr_common<V> const & p) : po_(p.share())
00076                         {
00077                         }
00078 
00079                         block_ptr_common(block_ptr_common<value_type> const & p) : po_(p.share())
00080                         {
00081                         }
00082 
00083                 template <typename V>
00084                         block_ptr_common & operator = (detail::bp::block<V> * p)
00085                         {
00086                                 reset(p->element());
00087 
00088                                 return * this;
00089                         }
00090 
00091                 template <typename V>
00092                         block_ptr_common & operator = (block_ptr_common<V> const & p)
00093                         {
00094                                 if (p.po_ != po_)
00095                                 {
00096                                         reset(p.share());
00097                                 }
00098                                 return * this;
00099                         }
00100 
00101                         block_ptr_common & operator = (block_ptr_common<value_type> const & p)
00102                         {
00103                                 return operator = <value_type>(p);
00104                         }
00105 
00106                 value_type * get() const
00107                 {
00108                         return po_;
00109                 }
00110 
00111                 value_type * share() const
00112                 {
00113                         if (po_)
00114                         {
00115                                 header()->add_ref_copy();
00116                         }
00117                         return po_;
00118                 }
00119 
00120                 void reset(value_type * p = 0)
00121                 {
00122                         if (po_)
00123                         {
00124                                 header()->release();
00125                         }
00126                         po_ = p;
00127                 }
00128 
00129 #if ( defined(__SUNPRO_CC) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(__SUNPRO_CC, < 0x570) ) || defined(__CINT__)
00130         operator bool () const
00131         {
00132             return po_ != 0;
00133         }
00134 #elif defined( _MANAGED )
00135         static void unspecified_bool( this_type*** )
00136         {
00137         }
00138 
00139         typedef void (*unspecified_bool_type)( this_type*** );
00140 
00141         operator unspecified_bool_type() const // never throws
00142         {
00143             return po_ == 0? 0: unspecified_bool;
00144         }
00145 #elif \
00146         ( defined(__MWERKS__) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(__MWERKS__, < 0x3200) ) || \
00147         ( defined(__GNUC__) && (__GNUC__ * 100 + __GNUC_MINOR__ < 304) ) || \
00148         ( defined(__SUNPRO_CC) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(__SUNPRO_CC, <= 0x590) )
00149 
00150         typedef value_type * (this_type::*unspecified_bool_type)() const;
00151         
00152         operator unspecified_bool_type() const // never throws
00153         {
00154             return po_ == 0? 0: &this_type::get;
00155         }
00156 #else 
00157         typedef value_type * this_type::*unspecified_bool_type;
00158 
00159         operator unspecified_bool_type() const // never throws
00160         {
00161             return po_ == 0? 0: &this_type::po_;
00162         }
00163 #endif
00164 
00165         // operator! is redundant, but some compilers need it
00166 
00167         bool operator! () const // never throws
00168         {
00169             return po_ == 0;
00170         }
00171 
00172         long use_count() const // never throws
00173         {
00174             return header()->use_count();
00175         }
00176 
00177         protected:
00178                 detail::bp::block_base * header() const
00179                 {
00180                         detail::bp::block_base * p = (block<value_type> *) (typename block<value_type>::roofof) static_cast<value_type *>(rootof<is_polymorphic<value_type>::value>::get(po_));
00181                         return p;
00182                 }
00183         };

00186 template <typename T>
00187         class block_ptr_base : public block_ptr_common<T>
00188         {
00189         typedef block_ptr_common<T> base;
00190         typedef typename base::value_type value_type;
00191                 
00192         protected:
00193                 using base::po_;
00194 
00195         public:
00196                 block_ptr_base() : base()
00197                 {
00198                 }

00203                         }

00208                         }

00211                         {
00212                         }
00213 
00214                 template <typename V>
00215                         block_ptr_base & operator = (detail::bp::block<V> * p)
00216                         {
00217                                 return static_cast<block_ptr_base &>(base::operator = (p));
00218                         }
00219

00229                         }
00230 
00231                 value_type & operator * () const
00232                 {
00233                         return * po_;
00234                 }
00235 
00236                 value_type * operator -> () const
00237                 {
00238                         return po_;
